messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] kids poetry magazine
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Amy - Stone Soup is a magazine written by kids 8-13.  We love it. http://www.stonesoup.com/ ~Rue I m wondering if anyone knows of a poetry/fiction magazine
messages.messageBody:
Hi Amy - Stone Soup is a magazine written by kids 8-13. We love it.
http://www.stonesoup.com/ ~Rue
I'm wondering if anyone knows of a poetry/fiction magazine for kids with
the poetry/fiction being submitted by the kids?


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] kids poetry magazine
messages.msgSnippet: You want to look at LMP at your library - here s a bit of why, from Publisher s Weekly: http://www.pw.org/info7.htm Though it is pitched to the adult author as
messages.messageBody:
You want to look at LMP at your library - here's a bit of why,
from Publisher's Weekly:
http://www.pw.org/info7.htm

Though it is pitched to the adult author as a page, the sources
listed include info about houses that publish stuff by kids.


----- Original Message -----
From: <amycats2@...>
To: <Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, July 05, 2003 2:52 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] kids poetry magazine


| Hi,
| I'm wondering if anyone knows of a poetry/fiction magazine
for kids with
| the poetry/fiction being submitted by the kids? I'm looking for
the 12yo
| daughter of a friend. I've been searching online and the
closest I came is a magazine
| called Creative Kids. There are tons of E-zines but I'm looking
for a print
| magazine.
| Thanks for any help!
| Amy
|
| Amy Kagey
| Email me for a list
| of used homeschooling books!

messages.subject: kids poetry magazine
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m wondering if anyone knows of a poetry/fiction magazine for kids with the poetry/fiction being submitted by the kids? I m looking for the 12yo daughter
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I'm wondering if anyone knows of a poetry/fiction magazine for kids with
the poetry/fiction being submitted by the kids? I'm looking for the 12yo
daughter of a friend. I've been searching online and the closest I came is a magazine
called Creative Kids. There are tons of E-zines but I'm looking for a print
magazine.
Thanks for any help!
Amy

Amy Kagey
Email me for a list
of used homeschooling books!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
